definitions.definition: The use of state or group power to control freedom of expression or press , such as passing laws to prevent undesirable media from being published or propagated.
The role of the censor ( magistrate ) in Ancient Rome.

main_definition: The use of state or group power to control freedom of expression or press , such as passing laws to prevent undesirable media from being published or propagated.
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) The role of the censor ( magistrate ) in Ancient Rome.
